## progress() function

Create a progress bar component builder.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function progress(options?: ProgressBuilderOptions): ComponentBuilder<ProgressModel>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[ProgressBuilderOptions](./dsl.progressbuilderoptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Configuration options for the progress bar


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[ComponentBuilder](./dsl.componentbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;[ProgressModel](./progress.progressmodel.md)<!-- -->&gt;

A `ComponentBuilder` ready to use with `AppBuilder.component`

## Remarks

Creates a `ComponentBuilder` wrapping the `@boba-cli/progress` package. The progress bar animates smoothly with spring physics when updated via `ProgressModel.setPercent()`<!-- -->. Animation is triggered by calling `setPercent()` on the model, not automatically on initialization.

## Example 1

Basic usage:

```typescript
const app = createApp()
  .component('progress', progress())
  .view(({ components }) => components.progress)
  .build()
```

## Example 2

With gradient styling:

```typescript
const app = createApp()
  .component('progress', progress({
    gradient: {
      start: '#5A56E0',
      end: '#EE6FF8',
      scaleGradientToProgress: false
    },
    showPercentage: true
  }))
  .view(({ components }) => vstack(
    text('Loading...'),
    components.progress
  ))
  .build()
```

## Example 3

With custom spring animation:

```typescript
const app = createApp()
  .component('progress', progress({
    spring: {
      frequency: 25,
      damping: 0.8
    }
  }))
  .view(({ components }) => components.progress)
  .build()
```
